column4: I am come back. I tried reinstall the driver for VGA.But there are many problems.
The driver AMD supported for my computer can not install on ubuntu 12.04
what version of the AMD driver?
My computer is DELL inspiron 1526 and the VGA card is X1200. The card is not supported in the new driver.
you don't need the proprietary AMD driver, open-source default driver works fine
Then I uninstalled the driver from ATI , reboot the computer. It worked.
But now , It can work only 2D
yes, I think it maybe the unity problem.
where can I paste the Xorg.0.log file?
I saw many output like [   327.023] (EE) FBDEV(0): FBIOPUTCMAP: Invalid argument
DarwinSurivor, I pasted the Xorg file at http://paste.ubuntu.com/977809/
(EE) Failed to load module "ati" (module does not exist, 0)
yes I saw it. But there is no any ati driver I can install
you're missing the ati driver, make sure xserver-xorg-video-ati package is installed
I installed radeon and ati package.I need reboot and make it take effect. Thank you, I will try
